description: Automation domain exposes commands for automating user interactions with the browser.

types.description: An opaque identifier for a browsing context.
An opaque identifier for a frame in a page.
An opaque identifier for a node in a page.

This enum contains predefined error messages that can be used to signal a well-defined error condition, such as a missing implementation, unknown window handle, and so forth. The backend signals one of these errors by using it as a prefix of the commands's error message (the errorString argument in generated C++ backend dispatchers). This will be reported to the frontend as a protocol error with a JSON-RPC error code of 'ServerError'. It is up to the frontend whether and how to deal with errors.
A handle representing an open window or tab in the automation session.

properties.name: handle
properties.description: Opaque handle for a browsing context (window or tab). Used as a key for window-related commands.

properties.name: active
properties.description: Whether the browsing context has focus at the time the command is handled.

properties.name: url
properties.description: The URL loaded by the browsing context at the time the command is handled.

properties.name: windowSize
properties.description: The current size of the browsing context's window.

properties.name: windowOrigin
properties.description: The current (x, y) position of the browsing context's window relative to the top-left of the screen.

types.description: Enumerates different ways of interacting with a mouse cursor.
Enumerates different mouse buttons that can be used.
Enumerates different key modifiers that can remain pressed during other mouse/touch interactions.
Enumerates different platform-independent virtual keys on a physical keyboard whose input via keyboard may or may not produce characters.

Enumerates different ways of interacting with a keyboard device. 'InsertByKey' implies that a separate KeyDown and KeyUp event are produced for each combining character sequence, regardless of the actual keystrokes required to produce the character sequence.

A single step in a key sequence. A step can contain a key up/down of a virtual key, or a sequence of Unicode code points that are delivered to the page at grapheme cluster boundaries. Either a 'key' or 'text' property must be specified.

properties.name: type
properties.description: The type of interaction to be performed by a step.

properties.name: key
properties.description: A virtual key to be used to perform the specified interaction.

properties.name: text
properties.description: A unicode string to be delivered to the page. The sequence of key events is determined by splitting the string at grapheme cluster boundaries.

commands.name: getBrowsingContexts
commands.description: Fetches information about all open browsing contexts (windows and tabs) in the automation session.

returns.name: contexts
returns.description: All known browsing contexts available to the session.

commands.name: getBrowsingContext
commands.description: Fetches information about the specified browsing context.

parameters.name: handle
parameters.description: The handle for the browsing context.

returns.name: context
returns.description: The browsing context available to the session.

commands.name: createBrowsingContext
commands.description: Opens a new browsing context in the automation session and makes it the active browsing context for user interaction. This command creates a browsing context in a new window rather than adding a tab to an existing window.

returns.name: handle
returns.description: An opaque handle for the newly created browsing context.

commands.name: closeBrowsingContext
commands.description: Try to close the specified browsing context. This can trigger an unload prompt and thereafter succeed or fail.

parameters.name: handle
parameters.description: The handle for the browsing context that should be closed.

commands.name: switchToBrowsingContext
commands.description: Activates the specified browsing context and optional frame, which gives them focus (causing the 'focus' DOM event to fire, and 'blur' DOM event to fire for the previous browsing context and frame).

parameters.name: browsingContextHandle
parameters.description: The handle for the browsing context that should be made focused.

parameters.name: frameHandle
parameters.description: The handle for the frame that should be focused. Defaults to the main frame if omitted.

commands.name: resizeWindowOfBrowsingContext
commands.description: Resizes the window of the specified browsing context to the specified size.

parameters.name: handle
parameters.description: The handle for the browsing context to be resized.

parameters.name: size
parameters.description: The new size for the browsing context's window.

commands.name: moveWindowOfBrowsingContext
commands.description: Moves the window of the specified browsing context to the specified position.

parameters.name: handle
parameters.description: The handle for the browsing context to be moved.

parameters.name: origin
parameters.description: The new origin for the browsing context's window. The position is interpreted in screen coordinate space, relative to the upper left corner of the screen.

commands.name: navigateBrowsingContext
commands.description: Navigates a browsing context to a specified URL.

parameters.name: handle
parameters.description: The handle for the browsing context that should be navigated.

parameters.name: url
parameters.description: The URL to load in the browsing context.

commands.name: goBackInBrowsingContext
commands.description: Navigates a browsing context to go back one page in history.

parameters.name: handle
parameters.description: The handle for the browsing context that should be navigated.

commands.name: goForwardInBrowsingContext
commands.description: Navigates a browsing context to got forward one page in history.

parameters.name: handle
parameters.description: The handle for the browsing context that should be navigated.

commands.name: reloadBrowsingContext
commands.description: Reloads the current page in a browsing context.

parameters.name: handle
parameters.description: The handle for the browsing context that should be reloaded.

commands.name: evaluateJavaScriptFunction
commands.description: Evaluates a script function in a browsing context and calls it with the supplied arguments.

parameters.name: browsingContextHandle
parameters.description: The handle for the browsing context the script should be evaluated.

parameters.name: frameHandle
parameters.description: The handle for the frame the script should be evaluated. The main frame is used if this parameter empty string or excluded.

parameters.name: function
parameters.description: The script to evaluate in the browsing context. It must be a function result.

parameters.name: arguments
parameters.description: The arguments to pass to the function when called. They will be parsed as JSON before calling the function.

parameters.name: expectsImplicitCallbackArgument
parameters.description: The function expects a callback function as the last argument. It is expected to call this callback with a result.

returns.name: result
returns.description: The result returned by the called function. It is JSON encoded after the function returns or calls the callback.

commands.name: performMouseInteraction
commands.description: Simulates interaction with a mouse cursor.

parameters.name: handle
parameters.description: The browsing context to be interacted with.

parameters.name: position
parameters.description: The requested position for the mouse cursor, specified in viewport coordinates.

parameters.name: button
parameters.description: The button to use to perform the interaction. This parameter only has an effect for the Down, Up, Click, and DoubleClick mouse interactions.

parameters.name: interaction
parameters.description: The type of interaction to be performed with the mouse cursor.

parameters.name: modifiers
parameters.description: Key modifiers to be active during the mouse interaction.

returns.name: position
returns.description: The updated position of the mouse cursor, specified in viewport coordinates.

commands.name: performKeyboardInteractions
commands.description: Simulates delivering the results of pressing one or more keyboard keys together or successively.

parameters.name: handle
parameters.description: The handle for the browsing context which should receive key.

parameters.name: interactions
parameters.description: An ordered list of key sequences to be delivered using native key events.

commands.name: takeScreenshot
commands.description: Take a screenshot of the current page in a browsing context.

parameters.name: handle
parameters.description: The handle for the browsing context to take a screenshot of.

commands.name: resolveChildFrameHandle
commands.description: Determines the FrameHandle based on the ordinal, name or node handle of a child frame.

parameters.name: browsingContextHandle
parameters.description: The handle for the browsing context in which to search for the frame.

parameters.name: frameHandle
parameters.description: The handle for the frame in which to search for the frame. The main frame is used if this parameter empty string or excluded.

parameters.name: ordinal
parameters.description: The ordinal of the child frame to resolve as a FrameHandle. This is analogous to 'window.frames[ordinal]' in JavaScript.

parameters.name: name
parameters.description: The name of the child frame to resolve as a FrameHandle. This is analogous to 'window.frames[name]' in JavaScript.

parameters.name: nodeHandle
parameters.description: The handle of the child frame owner element to resolve as a FrameHandle.

commands.name: resolveParentFrameHandle
commands.description: Determines the FrameHandle for the parent frame of the supplied FrameHandle.

parameters.name: browsingContextHandle
parameters.description: The handle for the browsing context the frame is located.

parameters.name: frameHandle
parameters.description: The handle for the frame that should resolve its parent frame.

commands.name: computeElementLayout
commands.description: Computes the layout for an element.

parameters.name: browsingContextHandle
parameters.description: The handle for the browsing context the frame is located.

parameters.name: frameHandle
parameters.description: The handle for the frame that contains the element.

parameters.name: nodeHandle
parameters.description: The handle of the element to use.

parameters.name: scrollIntoViewIfNeeded
parameters.description: If the element should be scrolled into view before computing its layout.

parameters.name: useViewportCoordinates
parameters.description: If the result coordinates should be represented as viewport coordinates or not. Defaults to false, which means coordinates should be represented as page coordinates.

returns.name: rect
returns.description: The layout rect for the requested element. Specified in page or viewport coordinates based on the useViewportCoordinates parameter.

commands.name: isShowingJavaScriptDialog
commands.description: Checks if a browsing context is showing a JavaScript alert, confirm, or prompt dialog.

parameters.name: browsingContextHandle
parameters.description: The handle for the browsing context.

returns.name: result
returns.description: If the browsing context is showing a JavaScript dialog or not.

commands.name: dismissCurrentJavaScriptDialog
commands.description: Dismisses a JavaScript alert, confirm, or prompt dialog currently showing in a browsing context. Equivalent to clicking the 'Cancel' button.

parameters.name: browsingContextHandle
parameters.description: The handle for the browsing context.

commands.name: acceptCurrentJavaScriptDialog
commands.description: Accepts a JavaScript alert, confirm, or prompt dialog currently showing in a browsing context. Equivalent to clicking the 'OK' button.

parameters.name: browsingContextHandle
parameters.description: The handle for the browsing context.

commands.name: messageOfCurrentJavaScriptDialog
commands.description: Returns the text displayed in a JavaScript alert, confirm, or prompt dialog currently showing in a browsing context.

parameters.name: browsingContextHandle
parameters.description: The handle for the browsing context.

returns.name: message
returns.description: Text being displayed in the current JavaScript dialog.

commands.name: setUserInputForCurrentJavaScriptPrompt
commands.description: Sets the user entered value in a JavaScript prompt dialog currently showing in a browsing context.

parameters.name: browsingContextHandle
parameters.description: The handle for the browsing context.

parameters.name: userInput
parameters.description: The text to enter in the prompt.
